Posts.Content: Hi Tigermum and Helen K, Jusr thought I would chip in re docetaxel, I saw my oncologist today and I am good to go for my 4th Docetaxel, Herceptin and Perjeta next Tuesday. After Christmas I change to 3x EC. I have been really lucky as I have not suffered any sickness or nausea, but he did say that EC was much more likely to cause these symptoms. So hopefully you too will be lucky and won’t feel sick on docetaxel. I havent found docetaxel too bad, just a set of very annoying SEs plus a progressive tiredness though each cycle.  If you want to know more, just shout! Hugs x
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Yes, I too have a rash on my hands, face, arms chest and back. It’s very hot and itchy. It also blisters and bleeds! My oncologist said it is the docetaxel. I’ve tried piriton, bio oil, suocream but nothing seems to help. In fact it makes it worse! Very annoying! I am seeing him this week and see if he recommends anything.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: So am I, 4th dose of domestos just before Christmas, sorry Docetaxel.   Hugs x
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi couttleberry I’m on same treatment as you but the other way round, so I have had my third of four Perjeta, Herceptin and docetaxel this week and will switch to 3x EC in New year. Then 13 Herceptin after lumpectomy and 3 weeks of radiation. The nurses in the chemo unit thought EC was harder! So I have no idea really. I think everyone is different and we all seem to have different but similar SEs. Anyway, pleased you are back on track after your tooth extraction- all you needed!  i haven’t found docetaxel too bad, but it seems to play havoc with my insides and I am still having problems with my rear end! So much so I have had to take further advice from my chemo nurse who then asked me to come in and be checked over! So five hours later, and various doctors inspecting an area that doesn’t see the light of day that often, a blood test with another bl***y canular, talk of blood transfusions and the like, they all decide I am not going to snuff it on them and send me home with a referral for a colonoscopy! The nurse then  rips out the canular and my hand swells up like a ballon and now looks like I’ve been in a flight!. Oh and finally, DH has the mother of all colds and cough...... Hugs xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi RumCat Good luck with you pre chemo assessment today and your first chemo tomorrow, I will be having my 4th tomorrow as well so I will be holding your virtual hand. My first session took 7 hours, so make sure you take lots of things to do, Mags, books, food, drinks etc. The anticipation is much worse than the actual event so just try and relax. The staff are great and will look after you. Good luck and hugs. X
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Morning Tigermum, hope you are doing well, sorry for the delay in answering your question but I have been busy getting everything done before my chemo tomorrow. It is amazing the difference in how I feel in my third week! Like normal hurrah!  So to try and help you and anyone having their first docetaxel, here are a list of SE that I experienced. I will say at this point that i feel I have tolerated it well. First of all the good news, I have not been sick or even felt sick at all, but I have been warned that I might find EC more nauseous!  I did get mouth ulcers on my first cycle, but have been fine since. i have had very sore skin, my face and hands have been very sore, I do have sensitive skin, but even my hypoallergenic cream made my skin nip. Got badly sunburnt during cycle two playing golf!  My nose has run constantly, with my nasal passages being as dry as dust, this has been the worse SE. My nose is so sore and for two pins, bleeds. If I go outside in the cold it pours! Disgusting!  Tired,  Need a sleep in the afternoon and bed at 9.00. Sleep was fitful to start with, but much better this cycle. But I have been much more tired this cycle, so much so I haven’t had the energy to do much exercise, whereas in the first two I was still playing golf and gardening.  I have not had any joint pain, just cramp in my feet and hands.  I can’t eat much, just pick at my food, but try and eat a well balanced diet of plenty of fruit and veg. I have lost 4.5 kgs!  My tastle buds have gone, everything tastes very salty, so my poor OH has had to put up with some strange recipes! Alcohol tastes like vinegar so have gone teetotal.  Chemo brain! Memory is poor! Just have to make copious lists!  My nails are very sore, and find it difficult to do things with my hands, I may lose my nails, so I have trimmed then to stop them catching on things. My hospital has given 10 days worth of WBC injections that have really worked, my WBC count is now over 8.0! I also get a course of antibiotics to take during week 2. Plus a drug to line my stomach (so no reflux) I feel this combination has really helped with my general well being. Anyway, I hope this helps and that you tolerant docetaxel well. In finishing, the best bit is that my lump had definitely shrunk, so much so that I can’t feel it anymore!  Hugs xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I am less than 48 hours before my first chemo and discussed fasting with my oncologist. In her opinion continuing to eat a balanced diet is the best way forward, so I am looking forward to a full roast dinner later! I think however, I will eat lightly tomorrow, but I plan to drink as much water as I can cope with.  My view is that this is the last few days my taste buds will be normal so I plan to give them a good send off.  Hugs to all.
Posts.Title: Is anyone trying FASTING (restricting Calories) before chemo to reduce...

Posts.Content: I am also finished, thank goodness. 7 cycles done. Now on to lumpectomy 13 Herceptin injections and radiotherapy. Many thanks for all the help and support, these forums are a life saver. Best wishes to everyone who maybe starting this month and those continuing. Keep positive and keep posting!
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hello, My hospital’s protocol is 4 to 6 weeks after last chemo, it’s sensible as you need to recover from last chemo, but they don’t want to leave it too long as the cancer may well start growing again. Your daughter’s surgeon should give her this information at her review meeting. My surgery is booked in for 4 weeks post last chemo.  But I understand that some hospitals work on 3 to 8 weeks. Hope this helps. x
Posts.Title: Timing of surgery after TCHP

Posts.Content: Blimey, AnnJac that really take some beating. What on earth is a heath professional say such rubbish. If only it was that easy...........we would live for ever! Hope your op went ok and you are out and about very soon.  Sue
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Yes this thread is brilliant, it’s so great to be able to off load some of the things well meaning people say to people who absolutely get it, and why it hacks you off. How about this then! A very well meaning friend on hearing that I had been diagnosed with BC lent me two books to read. They were basically about diet and how sugar and fat and meat are the reason why you get cancer.............. The first thing I did was look when they were written. One was 1997 and the other 2003! So I then turned to the index and looked up HER2+. One didn’t even mention it and the other had one paragraph which went something like, HER2+ is an aggressive untreatable type of BC.  I also asked my oncologist his thoughts on the diet! He rolled his eyes and said, ‘if it was that easy, don’t you think we would have told everyone’.  His advise was to eat a balanced diet and everything in moderation. I kept the books a couple of weeks and returned then with a little note of thanks......... Sue
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I have enjoyed reading everyone’s experiences of what people say and the cracking responses!  I bumped into an old friend (male) who hadn’t see me since my diagnosis. After listening to the long  tale of his pacemaker and subsequent newly found running exploits. He ask how I was. So I explained that I had been diagnosed with breast cancer and was going though a course of chemo. His question was, “ so what your prognosis then” ! So what was I expected to say? I just mumbled something inane and made my excuses. Blimey, it take a lot to shock me BUT!  Sue
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Hi Couttleberry  yes, I have the same dilemma. I have an appointment on Monday, in desperate need for a colour, but realise that’s a waste of money, I plan to talk to my hairdresser, who is a sweetheart and ask his advice about how short and what type of wig. I have shoulder length hair at the moment. I also have a wig appointment booked next week so will see what that brings...
Posts.Title: Hair cut due, what to do?

Posts.Content: It’s like many things in life, the first time is often the most scary. I had 10 days worth of injections x7 rounds of chemo! No way was I going to the hospital or getting any sort of support from the district nurse. Once you’ve braved your first one, the rest are not bad. A nurse friend suggested letting the antiseptic wipe dry before injecting, otherwise you push a little bit of it into you and it stings! Pinch a bit of tummy fat near your belly button an push firmly but gently. The needle is so fine it shouldn’t hurt. The spring loaded injections make the rest of it easy. Swap sides each day.  But boy was I was pleased when I got to number 70!  Just to let you know, I was completely fine on chemo and my wbc actually went up. Sepsis is no joke and if these keep you safe then it’s worth it. Good luck with your treatment. It’s hard but doable. Sue
Posts.Title: advice on giving injections after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi couttleberry how are you doing?  I started chemo the same time as you, but the other way round! I have had 4 HP + D followed by 3 EC, my last EC is in 10days yippee! Sorry, but my hair fell out 14 days after first Docetaxel and the nurses said that the EC would see off the rest! Although I have lost more, I am not completely bald, just looks like I have a really bad Mohican . I have found EC must kinder than Docetaxel. I still have my eye lashes although my eyebrows are a little skinny!  Best wishes
Posts.Title: Hair returning - but should I get excited?
